meanings.definition: To erect or set up in advance.
meanings.sent1: The workers preerected the stage before the concert.
meanings.sent2: We preerected the tent for the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The students preerected their project to impress the teacher.
meanings.sent4: She preerected her argument before the debate.
meanings.sent5: The chef preerected the ingredients for the recipe.

meanings.definition: Already erected or set up before.
meanings.sent1: The preerected structure stood tall against the skyline.
meanings.sent2: The preerected building saved time during construction.
meanings.sent3: The preerected puzzle was already solved when I got it.
meanings.sent4: The preerected fence marked the boundary of the property.
meanings.sent5: The preerected statue was a landmark in the city.
